title: Is there any way I can remotely use my PC to call from my phone and converse via the PC? - Quora

response.answer_text: I think the word “remotely” in the original question causes there to be confusion.My understanding of the question:“Is there a way to place calls from my PC, remotely using my phone’s hardware” If you are looking to remotely VIEW and CONTROL your phone, any of the previously mentioned remoting tools (Teamviewer, etc) are fine, but are not designed to make calls over. I feel the OP is looking for something like this: Remote Phone Callallowing a PC user to control their phone’s communications. Note they have multiple setups, that require different capabilities from your phone. Their typical setup suggests you still pair your BT voice-device (ie. headset) with the phone directly anyway, although not necessary in their hands-free setup. Recently, however, Windows 10’s Your Phone app can now act like a car might when paired via BT, allowing calls to be made through your PC.Setting up and using calls Bluetooth, in these cases are your best option for good quality communications, but may not be appropriate if the OP is looking to leave their phone outside of BT range. So… If looking for close range - get a GOOD bluetooth interface for your PC, and check out the above methods. If looking for LAN/Wifi/WAN use, without some hacky methods, and dealing with latency and dynamic IP issues, you’re better off using a VoIP service. They typically have good proprietary software, or are compatible with 3rd party software and VoIP USB devices. You can even install a VoIP app on your phone/tablets, so that could use the same account from all devices. A bit more technical on why we don’t see easier mobile-to-pc connections more…. IIRC, there are security restrictions on the embedded APIs (or even no user-API available), concerning access to the audio IO streams inside the enclosed ADC-codec-BT-Baseband-modem/network setup. This prevents applications from messing with things it shouldn’t be concerned with. So outside of BT connectivity (being limited to BT abilities and specs) there isn’t going to be a lot of options. For now. For those looking to have a more scalable solution… Allowing PC and phones alike, to share calls, conference, handle voicemail, have extensions - via Wifi/LAN/WAN - checkout Open Standards Communications Solution - 3CX IP PBX.Even a low powered VM can run an office and be connected-to externally. (You can think of it as having your own local private VoIP service, based on a real VoIP subscription)

If I understand correctly the question aims to use a smart phone to initiate a call from a PC that you can hear and participate in from the smart phone, and as a result the person being called would be called only from the PC. I’ve not tried this but I’d expect it to work:: Equip a smart phone and PC with remote control software to access your PC from the phone (GoToMyPC, Microsoft Remote Desktop, Splashtop, TeamViewer, LogMeIn, and more are all possibilities. See our related Quora answer: Connectivity: Whats better for remote access LogMeIn, GoToMyPC or another?)Acquire a PC-based phone number with a service like Skype, MagicJack, etc.Initiate a remote control session from the smart phone to the PC.Initiate a call from the PC to your smart phone.While the line remains open continue to use the smart phone’s remote access software to make the desired call using the 3–way calling feature.At this point your smart phone has voice and data connections to the PC and your smart phone should be able to “…remotely use my PC to call from my phone and converse via the PC”.
